PLEASURE.Definition: enjoyment, happiness, or satisfaction, or something that gives this

CONTEXT.Definition: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

UGH.Definition: used to express a strong feeling of disgust (= disapproval and dislike) at something very unpleasant

MEDIOCRE.Definition: just acceptable but not good; not good enough

SATISFACTORY.Definition: good or good enough for a particular need or purpose

TERRIBLE.Definition: very unpleasant or serious or of low quality

DISTRESSINGLY.Definition: in a way that causes worry, sadness, or pain

INCOMPETENT.Definition: not having the ability to do something as it should be done

DISAPPOINTING.Definition: not as good as you had hoped or expected; not satisfactory

IGNORE.Definition: to intentionally not listen or give attention to

BLACK SHEEP.Definition: someone who embarrasses a group or family because the person is different or has gotten into trouble

FULFILL.Definition: to do something that is expected, hoped for, or promised, or to cause it to happen

ASPIRATIONS.Definition: something that you hope to achieve

VULGAR.Definition: not appropriate, simple, dignified or beautiful; not in the style preferred by the upper classes of society

SLANG.Definition: very informal language that is usually spoken rather than written, used especially by particular groups of people

CONTEMPTIBLE.Definition: deserving a strong feeling of dislike or blame

INFERIOR.Definition: not good, or not as good as someone or something else

AS HELL.Definition: used to emphasize a description of an unpleasant characteristic

EMPHASIS.Definition: special attention given to something because it is important or because you want it to be noticed, or an example of this

CURSE.Definition: to use a word or an expression that is not polite and shows that you are very angry

SUCK.Definition: if someone or something sucks, that person or thing is bad or unpleasant
